items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: DevOps, Product Manager
Industry: Cybersecurity, DevOps, Internet Infrastructure

Job description

Summary

As a Security Cloud Transformation Project Manager for New Context, you will be expected to provide technical leadership with a hands-on approach. On a daily basis you will be interfacing with our clients and other New Context team members while working from the New Context office, at client sites, or from your home. This position provides technical Project Management in order to develop and implement security policies for AWS cloud migration.  We are seeking a hands on leader with both Systems Engineering capabilities and a track record of successfully leading security policy initiatives to fruition, preferably within the context of a professional consulting engagement.

Requirements

Seasoned Project Manager

  • 10+ Years experience within Software Engineering that has branched into Project Management
  • Proven track record of guiding projects to successful completion, facilitating with engineering teams, core business units and other relevant stakeholders to ensure fulfillment of project milestones in a timely manner.
  • Experience managing engineering teams, with a solid understanding of technical requirements and the ability to assign responsibilities to appropriate team members.
  • Proactive leader who takes actions to remove blockers that may hold back Engineering efforts, in a way that is both effective, yet also respectful of client concerns and processes
  • Possess solid organizational skills and ensure that detailed documentation occurs with reference to progress, resources, timeline, and changes to scope of work; communicating with proper documentation issues as they arise to our clients to prevent unnecessary delays in progress.
  • Training in Agile Project Management methodology preferred

Security Expertise in the Cloud

  • Experience architecting security policies within large scale enterprise environments
  • Knowledgeable in compliance standards for AWS, Chef Compliance within AWS additionally
  • Knowledgeable in topics such as: firewalls, scanners, OSSEC, Encryption, ID Federation
  • Strong understanding of OWASP Top 10 and CWE/Sans Top 25
  • Security credentials such as CISSP, CISA, CISM, GSEC etc. preferred

Excellent communication skills

  • Experience working with external clients and customers
  • Translate complex concepts to business customers
  • Provide regular updates to relevant stakeholders on project performance
  • Coordinate and enhance communication across teams
  • Professional consulting experience is strongly preferred

Hands On Engineering Expertise

  • In depth knowledge of Amazon Web Services cloud platform with specific knowledge of security policies for data migration.  Knowledge in other public cloud platform security policies (such as Azure or Google Cloud) is preferred but not essential.
  • Competent programmer, ideally with fluency in languages like Ruby, Python, Golang etc.
  • Hands on cloud automation experience with Configuration Management tools like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Salt etc.
  • Knowledgeable in Containerization Ecosystem with hands on usage of Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, Mesosphere etc.
  • Understands the importance of Test Driven Development in practice

About New Context Services

New Context is a rapidly growing consulting company in the heart of downtown San Francisco.  We specialize in Lean Security; an approach that leads organizations to build better software thru hands-on technical and management consulting. We are a group of engineers who live and breath Agile Infrastructure, Systems Automation, Cloud Orchestration, and Information Security.

The New Context team personifies the DevOps spirit. We love a challenge and look forward to working with clients to solve their own challenges. Our teams operate with complete stack awareness of infrastructure, application and security.

Our driving methodologies are Lean Security and Humane Systems. In adopting a security first approach to infrastructure focused on people, processes and technologies, our team will have an integral part in driving the direction of these exciting new approaches.

Great office on Market Street
Any tools you need to get your work done
The opportunity to be a leader in a growing company

Opportunity for 2 exceptional Business Development Managers to join a well-funded London based IoT startup focused on residential property tech



*Role*: Business Development Manager, Switchee Ltd

*Reporting* *to*: Head of Sales

*Location*: Field based sales role: 1x North and 1x South. Head office in Camden, London

One in five households in the UK live in social housing, a sector with the right values at its core but that has historically struggled to deploy innovations in the home. Many residents still can’t afford to heat their homes and live in cold, mouldy properties they can’t be proud of. At Switchee, we believe that everyone deserves to live in a decent home and that the environments we inhabit have a massive influence on our ability to enjoy life and prosper.

We may be only three years old, but it’s already been quite a ride! Our first product, the internet connected Switchee thermostat is already in 35 of the biggest housing providers in the UK. We’re growing 100% year on year and are backed by some of the best-known investors in technology and social impact.

To strengthen our small team of 15 passionate and ambitious people we are looking for an outstanding individual to join us as

*Business* *Development* *Manager*.

We are driven by a collective desire to make a positive impact in the housing sector, both for residents and landlords, so your commitment to our values and mission are paramount.

*Your* *responsibilities*

This is a New Business Sales focused role. Due to expansion and success, the Switchee sales division has created a new role of Business Development Manager. The successful applicant will have an interest in the smart technology space and some experience of selling to the social housing market. The key activities to be undertaken by the successful candidate:



* To generate profitable sales revenues through selling
* Switchee Smart Thermostats to Social Housing Providers
* To generate commercial interest in the Switchee product through promotion at exhibitions, trade shows, social media etc.
* To promote Switchee and the brand through all external communications
* To be the first port of call for incoming sales enquiries
* To update and track sales opportunities through our CRM system
* To liaise with Switchee internal departments to maximise sales opportunities e.g. Marketing
* To report sales leads/wins/losses/pipeline, hit unit sales targets and perform against department KPI’s
* To proactively look for business development opportunities through networking
* To actively seek and report back customer requirements and feedback
* To participate in team working to benefit the wider company goals, outside of your strict job description

We are a company built on a strong technical foundation. You’ll need to grasp and communicate a technical solution with clients. We also expect you to work closely with Product Development to ensure our product evolves with the customer’s needs at the very centre.

*Your* *experience*

We firmly believe extraordinary people can come from a wide range of places – but we wouldn’t be surprised if the person who gets this role has:

* 3yrs+ sales/account management experience
* Sales experience selling to Social Housing Providers (Housing Associations and Local Authorities)
* Ideally sold to Dir and Exec Dir level within asset management, sustainability, repairs, IT/digital
* Desire to work in a small, fast paced and exciting company within the emerging IoT space
* Some experience in the ventilation, heating controls, asset management software markets would be beneficial but not essential
* Bachelor’s degree from a top university
* Proven ability to develop and implement effective marketing strategies
* Strong analytical & numeracy skills with complete command of Excel
* Research skills to identify new potential customers and new market opportunities
* Knowledge of Hubspot and/or other CRM software systems
* Experience working with Internet of Things devices

*You*

We are a diverse bunch of people at Switchee. That said, there are some characteristics we always look for:

* You deeply care about Switchee’s mission; you have a desire to build something revolutionary, that will disrupt an industry, and positively impact ordinary people’s lives.
* You care about the environment, are interested in energy efficiency and have thought about the challenges and opportunities posed by an evolving domestic energy market
* You like technology and neat solutions to complex problems
* You thrive on challenge and change; you naturally gravitate to the hardest questions first and love thinking differently to solve them.
* You are biased towards action and you’re happiest when you’re ‘getting stuff done’.
* You’re open, positive & straightforward. You’re not afraid to stand up for your convictions, even when it’s hard to do so.
* You delight in your colleagues’ successes and thrive on your failures; you grasp any opportunity for learning and constantly seek to improve.

*Our* *mission*

We believe that radical innovation in internet connected technology can ensure that every resident, every day, is living in a home that allows them to succeed. That’s why our products are built not just on great technology, but on an understanding of what people want from the space they live in.

ABOUT US:

Born from the global movement spawned by bestselling-author Eric Ries, Lean Startup Company coaches a global community on the latest modern management techniques. We help advance Lean Startup principles, which provide a cutting edge, scientific framework for innovation and customer development. It’s about continuous testing so organizations of all sizes can effectively adapt and adjust before it’s too late.

Through our flagship conference, educational materials, and expert faculty, we arm organizations with the entrepreneurial tools necessary to transform how they work. We serve every size company and sector of the economy —- from the the aspiring entrepreneur to high-growth startups, nonprofits, and large bureaucratic institutions. Our engaged community looks to us for practical knowledge and valuable lessons in modern management.

ABOUT THE POSITION

We're seeking a Program Chair who’ll help us bring to the stage the most exciting, empowering stories of putting Lean Startup into practice in organizations around the world. We want to hear about the success stories, the still-working-through it stories, and the failures-that-lead-to-great-insights stories.

You’ll be helping current and future business leaders gain the personal insight necessary to make lasting change in their organizations. You’ll do this by curating engaging programming that highlights solutions to specific Lean Startup practitioner pain points—offering practical solutions to common problems as well as attendee networking opportunities—in the form of keynotes, interactive sessions, workshops, and other activities.

This is a remote, part-time position that allows you geographic flexibility while also giving you the power to positively impact our expansive community.

Join us if you’re eager to help our customers solve the world’s biggest business problems.

We’re seeking an entrepreneurial program chair experienced in the following core competencies:

  1. You’re a detail-oriented event programmer. You’ve worked in the conference space in the past and excel at booking speakers and activities that help resolve specific customer needs and encourage networking.
  2. You’re experienced in coaching speakers and reviewing decks to help ensure their presentations have maximum impact with your audiences. Lean Startup events shouldn’t feel like general tech/entrepreneur conferences; a strong program chair candidate understands the need to guide speakers on their presentations using our customer data and feedback.
  3. You’re well connected in the business/tech/innovation space and understand who the big players are that we should be inviting to speak at our conferences. You aim high and have solid follow-through in your ambitious speaking asks. You have experience managing a multitude of personalities and needs with utmost respect. You’re also an excellent communicator.
  4. You have examples of how you’ve helped large events run smoothly and efficiently and how you’ve helped enrich the programming.
  5. You share our commitment to diversity in our speaker lineups. Lean Startup Co. has taken the 50/50 Pledge, promising that at least 50% of our speakers are female; additionally we pledge to invite speakers who hail from diverse racial, ethnic, and cultural backgrounds.
  6. You think beyond the standard conference format, incorporating different types of sessions that help attendees network and learn in new and interesting ways.
Bonus points, if you:

  • Have strong writing and editing skills—meaning you can make sure our conference website is error-free and you can write blog posts/newsletter copy when there are big announcements about the conference (content themes, new speaker confirmations, etc.)
  • Have experience coaching people in public speaking. We enjoy empowering newer speakers by working with them on best practices when it comes to addressing large audiences.
  • Understand the needs of both enterprise and startup business leaders when it comes to modern management issues.
  • Know the latest talking points in the modern management/business/tech world.
  • Are already familiar with Eric Ries’ writing/The Lean Startup and/or similar innovation methodologies such as Agile and Design Thinking

In this role, you’ll work closely with Lean Startup Faculty, the Director of Events, and the Director of Marketing, but will take the lead on the following:

  • Understanding the core customer problems that we need to address in 2018 and breaking those needs down into specific tracks, themes, and and activities (i.e. keynotes, interactive sessions, roundtable discussions, etc.)
  • Doing all outreach, onboarding, and coaching of speakers for our 2018 conference. This includes reviewing speaker talks/decks, updating speakers with the most relevant information on our attendee demographics and customer needs, coaching them on the specific type of content we’re looking for, being on-site managing speakers during the conference, and following up with speakers post-conference to thank them for their participation.
  • Making sure the content we present our audiences is practical, non-sales-y, and from practitioners in the field. As speakers are preparing their talks, confidently and courteously communicating with them if the talks veer toward self-promotion; helping them shape presentations that focus on methods and strategies instead of marketing their companies/books/services.
  • Running and reviewing Lean Startup Co.’s call for speaker proposals; going through submissions to pull speakers from our community to be part of the conference lineup where appropriate.
  • Creating, editing, and maintaining the program grid as the programming evolves. Working with the Executive Producer to make sure all time constraints are accounted for in the programming.

*Our mission*

At Switchee, we believe that everyone deserves to live in a decent home and that the environments we inhabit have a massive influence on our ability to enjoy life and prosper.
One in five households in the UK live in social housing, a sector with the right values at its core but that has historically struggled to deploy innovations in the home. Many residents still can’t afford to heat their homes and live in cold, mouldy properties they can’t be proud of.  

We believe that radical innovation in internet connected technology can ensure that every resident, every day, is living in a home that allows them to succeed. That’s why our products are built not just on great technology, but on an understanding of what people want from the space they live in.

This approach led us to reimagine the most mundane household object, a thermostat, into a product that automagically reduces energy bills, looks great and offers control to those who want it.

We are also revolutionising the way social landlords manage their housing stock with an obsessively tailored SAAS property dashboard and handy alerts on things like when the boiler is going to break.

Our next project is to build the ultimate connected hub for the social home. It’s going to revolutionise the way residents interact with their properties and landlords manage their homes.

*Our journey*

We may be only three years old, but it’s already been quite a ride. Our first product, the internet connected Switchee thermostat is already in 35 of the biggest housing providers in the UK.
We’re growing 100% year on year and are backed by some of the best-known investors in technology and social impact. We are a small team of 15 passionate and ambitious people driven by a collective desire to make a positive impact in the housing sector, both for residents and landlords.
We are looking for an outstanding individual to run our marketing department, which promises to grow considerably over the coming years. Your commitment to our values and mission are paramount.
Your responsibilities

As Head of Marketing, you will oversee and deliver all marketing to continue growing the Switchee brand within the social housing sector and, as we grow, into other sectors (student housing, private rented sector) and geographies. You will be responsible for managing our external positioning and generating inbound leads to help us achieve our challenging growth targets.

*Being more specific, you will:*

• Set the marketing strategy and own all aspects of the delivery

• Help define how we communicate our mission and values to the outside world

• Oversee company rebrand & production of new website

• Deliver inbound leads at target volumes and against target CPAs

• Oversee PR & communications

• Generate insightful, thought provoking written content

• Manage social media (Twitter & LinkedIn)

• Work closely with the sales team to ensure CRO

• Organise attendance at conferences – negotiating exhibitor plots and speaking slots

• Prepare quarterly and annual overviews and forecasts

• Build, train & manage a marketing team

We are a company built on a strong technical foundation. You’ll need to grasp and communicate a technical solution with clients. We also expect you to work closely with Product Development to ensure our product evolves with the customer’s needs at the very centre.

*Your experience*

We firmly believe extraordinary people can come from a wide range of places – but we wouldn’t be surprised if the person who gets this role has:

• At least 3 years B2B marketing experience and team management skills

• Proven ability to develop and implement effective marketing strategies

• Research skills to identify new potential customers and new market opportunities

• Experience of a range of marketing tech applications

• A strong grasp of the relevance of “brand” & “DR” marketing

• Experience in a small & quickly expanding business

• Knowledge of the housing sector

*You*

We are a diverse bunch of people at Switchee. That said, there are some characteristics we always look for:

• You deeply care about Switchee’s mission; you have a desire to build something revolutionary, that will disrupt an industry, and positively impact ordinary people’s lives.

*You can expect…*

items.title: Hotjar: Director of Talent
items.content:
Director of Talent

Posted Feb 27

Hotjar
Headquarters: Malta
https://careers.hotjar.com/o/director-of-talent/?source=WeWorkRemotely
View all Hotjar jobs →

Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in time zones that align with Europe (UTC 0 to UTC +2, essentially between Ireland and Eastern Europe). 

Hotjar’s culture is the key to ensuring we are working together optimally to achieve our vision. This position will have the critical objective of ensuring culture is top of mind in everything we do for our team and for those that join our team in the future. Here’s a brief description of what we mean by culture. 

Hotjar's a fast-growing company with a diverse and remotely distributed team of 60+ individuals. We’re looking for someone with the experience, know-how, and mindset to help us achieve our vision by attracting and retaining a premium virtual team. In this role, culture must always be top of mind across everything we currently have in place, change, and/or introduce. 

The Director of Talent will have the responsibility for all people-based strategic and operational activities within Hotjar. They will regularly lead/oversee activities across a variety of areas, such as resource planning, recruitment, training and benefits/perks administration, and will be the first point of contact for internal team member issues handled outside of standard reporting relationships.

 

In this role, you will:

  • Ensure Hotjar’s people-based plans support the needs of the business, but are also flexible enough to align with our culture and cope with changes in the organization
  • Be the primary point of contact for HR related matters
  • Direct the development of norms around our cultural values and continuously execute on ways to reinforce them
  • Manage the recruitment strategy, process and team members for the company
  • Leveraging internal and external resources, create, maintain, and execute on processes and initiatives to actively identify and create demand for candidates that are ideal for open roles and cultivate mutual interest where there’s a fit
  • Ensure the recruitment process aligns with our values, measures emotional intelligence, and includes the right criteria to vet candidates. Iteratively review and improve it.
  • Guide leadership and team member actions by researching, developing, writing, and updating policies, procedures, methods, and guidelines for people related matters
  • Conduct a needs analyses for training, and develop a plan to fulfill the needs of the organization; manage the plan and its associated budget
  • Develop and improve an appraisal and performance based feedback system based on our values
  • Manage performance or grievance issues in a legally compliant, professional and business-minded way
  • Maintain and analyze information on data, such as team turnover, cost per recruitment hire, training hours per person, etc.
  • Develop, execute and maintain a compensation strategy that incorporates factors such as experience, skills, role commonality and diverse geographies
  • Propose and maintain a succession plan for all departments
  • Support the leadership team and team leads by providing personnel centered/human resources advice, counsel, mentoring and decision-making expertise
  • Develop, maintain, and run internal training programs on how to be a good team lead / leader in general and how to collaborate effectively as a remote team.
 

Compensation Range

The budgeted compensation range for this role is €80,000 to €110,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.

Requirements

  • At least 5 years of prior experience leading a Human Resource department (or equivalent) for a fast-growing company. This should include companies that have scaled beyond 100+ people.
  • Prior experience with defining and embracing a team culture within the workplace
  • Must be able to demonstrate prior experience putting HR/People Management processes, procedures, and tools in place and evolving, enhancing, and modifying them over time
  • Required to be both strategic in your work and a hands-on working leader. We’re a startup and everyone gets their hands dirty
  • Experience with developing, maintaining and executing on an ambitious recruitment plan
  • Prior experience with delivering training and public speaking
  • Ability to understand areas of potential concern pertaining to labor laws and situations
  • Must be highly organized. You’ll be dealing with a wide variety of issues on any given day. They’ll range from seemingly trivial to mission critical and must continuously be prioritized and acted upon appropriately
  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • The ideal candidate would experience within a remote based company or team
  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by a third party

Apply for this position

Please apply via https://careers.hotjar.com/o/director-of-talent/?source=WeWorkRemotely

About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Manager
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Financial Technology

Job description

A Software Manager at Confluence is responsible for leading a team of 8 to 12 Software Developers in the production of high-quality Cloud software products.  This position is responsible for the technology, staffing, development, delivery, and ongoing continuous improvement of the software engineering team.  The Software Manager takes a “hands-on” approach by participating in design decisions, code reviews, planning sessions and other technical discussions.   As part of a larger software product development organization, the Software Manager is involved in many cross-functional product and process improvement initiatives as both a team member and leader.  The Software Manager must work full-time from our Pittsburgh, PA office. 

What Will You Do?

  • Recruit, hire, train, mentor, and facilitate the success of a team of talented Software Engineers.
  • Create Employee Development Plans that support, encourage and evaluate personal growth.
  • Maintain team morale via regular individual and team-wide communications. 
  • Perform all HR management activities for your team.  
  • Set team goals and objectives that are aligned with technology, product and business plans.
  • Define, implement and improve software development processes and tools.
  • Support the team in project and product release planning processes.  
  • Lead the team to meeting their commitments by removing roadblocks and providing hands-on assistance. 
  • Stay current with technology trends and instill a continuous learning mindset in the team.
  • Ensure the team is adhering to established quality practices and is proactively identifying quality concerns.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to develop strategies to improve technology and enhance the product portfolio.
  • Occasionally design, develop and test software to maintain a good working knowledge of software development practices, technologies, tools and challenges. 

What Technical Skills Do You Need?
You should have eight or more years of experience in software development with two or more years managing and leading software teams.  

You need these technical skills:

  • Broad experience using Frontend technologies such as JavaScript, Typescript, html, css along with frameworks such as Angular, Aurelia, Bootstrap, Knockout and jQuery.  
  • Experience with backend technologies like C#, ASP.Net, SQL Server, and MongoDB.  Expertise in some subset of these technologies is highly desired.
  • Proven experience delivering commercial Cloud software products. 
  • Significant experience implementing and optimizing the tools and processes used throughout the Software Development Lifecycle.  DevOps or Continuous Integration & Deploy practices are highly desired.   
  • Thorough understanding of software quality practices including unit testing, secure software development practices, and non-functional testing. 
  • Work in an Agile software environment using Scrum.
    You need these management and leadership skills:
  • Expertise at creating high-performing teams focused on team success over individual recognition.
  • Effective at all types of HR People management activities.
  • Proven success developing, mentoring and coaching software engineers of various experience levels.  
  • Takes initiative in planning tasks, removing obstacle, and closing knowledge gaps.
  • Quality mindset.
  • Ability to collaborate cross-functionally.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.

We require a sound decision maker that utilizes knowledge of business to drive decisions with a great sense of commitment in doing the job right the first time. We are looking for someone with a strong willingness to learn continuously and take ownership and accountability.

Experience managing and leading geographically dispersed teams is required as several Confluence Software Developers work remotely full time from their home office.

Confluence's company culture and values guide our decisions, whether it's about product, brand or people. So, if you are an ambassador of Integrity, Imagination, Discipline and Service to others and have the skills and interest, we would love to hear from you.

About Confluence

Who is Confluence?

We are a Software Product Company. We produce cloud products that help investment companies optimize and control the information they need to manage their investment products. We are a company made up of exceptionally talented individuals who know what it means to work as a team. We seek the best engineers regardless of their location.  While we are headquartered in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania we have many team members working remotely across the United States.  Our Agile working environment fosters collaboration across our dispersed teams.  This environment allows everyone to bring their A game to create great software products and services that clients highly value. Confluence provides an opportunity to work in a fast-paced, client-focused, growth environment using state of the art software technologies, tools and processes.

Job description

At Stack Overflow, our mission is to serve developers. Whether we’re helping developers get answers to their questions or find new jobs, we build products that make millions of developers’ lives better every day. Our newest product, Stack Overflow for Teams, allows teams to ask and answer questions on Stack Overflow in a private space. This puts security at the center of our company strategy.

As our first Director of Information Security, your job is to design, implement, and monitor a security program that keeps our customers’ information safe. You’ll work directly with the CTO to evaluate risk and make decisions that will drive the business forward. You’ll build relationships across the company and work collaboratively, combining your security expertise with our experienced teams to rapidly roll out new security mechanisms and controls. And you’ll interface with our clients, to give them absolute confidence that their data is safe with us.

What you’ll do:

  • Design, implement and manage our overall information security program
  • Collaborate with devs and site reliability engineers to identify threats and design technical controls
  • Create and run security training programs for a variety of teams across the organization
  • Maintain documentation of security controls and respond to inquiries from clients, regulators (including on GDPR), and other third-parties
  • Work towards a goal of SOC 2 type II certification

What we're looking for:

  • 5+ years of hands-on experience in information security
  • 3+ years in a leadership role within information security, with a demonstrated ability to break down large problems and get things done
  • Knowledgeable on a broad range of threats and security topics including secure software development practices, networking, encryption, cloud security, etc.
  • Experience working in a technology company with fast-moving software development teams
  • Experience implementing security compliance frameworks and processes such as ISO 27001/2, NIST, and SOC II
  • Ability to work cross-team and communicate effectively with people from a variety of different backgrounds and different levels of security awareness
  • Certifications (preferred): CISSP, CISM, CISA or CRISC

What you’ll get in return:

  • Ability to work remotely, with flexible hours
  • 20 days paid vacation + holidays
  • Completely free health insurance - no copay, no premiums (US residents)
  • Generous parental leave (10-16 weeks at 100% pay), family care leave, and unlimited sick days

Stack Overflow is the largest, most trusted online community for developers to learn, share their knowledge, and build their careers. More than 50 million professional and aspiring programmers visit Stack Overflow each month to help solve coding problems, develop new skills, and find job opportunities.

We partner with businesses to help them understand, hire, engage, and enable the world's developers. Our products and services are focused on developer marketing, technical recruiting, market research, and enterprise knowledge sharing.

We believe in hiring smart people and getting out of their way. We have an office in New York with some of the best amenities of any New York startup, and we have people who work remotely all over the world.  We keep meetings and ceremony to an absolute minimum.

But we want to add this:

Currently seeking an awesome Project Manager (Aka Conscious Stories Mama)

www.ConsciousStories.com

 

ABOUT YOU

So let’s start by talking about you.

 

You live a conscious path and can articulate your choices… whatever they are. Are you into meditation,  journaling, yoga? We love them all. I’m so glad you have found your teachers and know what inspires you. We’re pretty sure you took one look at our website and went “I love it.” Our mission resonates with you and you are ready to jump in and dedicate your time and effort  to help us grow.

 

In our opinion, there are two sides to being a stellar project manager — managing projects and managing people. We’re looking for someone who is absolutely INCREDIBLE at both!  

 

You are outrageously organized — color-coding, folders, and systems are the stuff of dreams. Taking an idea and turning it into a timeline of clear deliverables actually sounds like a fun way to spend a day to you! You are incredibly skilled at both micro and macro thinking — making sure the big picture is always moving forward by way of all the tiny details that need to get done.

 

You also love people — you’re a natural mentor and sounding board, and knowing that you helped someone else succeed gives you enormous satisfaction. You love coaching people to do their best, seeing people’s strengths and talents and drawing it out of them even more. You naturally pick up on subtle team dynamics and are able to proactively jump in to assuage a concern or just offer a few words of encouragement.

 

You are an incredible problem solver — you are strategic, clever, and quick on your feet. You’ll be the go-to person when we’re trying to figure out a sticky issue. You are extremely resourceful and great at playing detective — you can unravel any problem and figure out what’s really going on, what the missing pieces are, and go out and find them. You do NOT thrive on being micromanaged and love to be given the freedom to excel in your job. Being your own boss within an organization is a dream come true for you. You are open, direct, and straightforward.

 

You believe that honesty, awareness, and ownership are the direct routes to problem solving. You’d rather not play the “blame game,” but instead just correct the issue and keep moving! You are a solution-based thinker who investigates why things went wrong with the goal of improving the process. You believe that a process problem lies at the root of every apparent people problem. It is pretty impossible to faze you and you’re able to take a hit and keep rolling — your goal is to get it done, even if the path that gets there isn’t quite the one that you anticipated!

 

ABOUT THIS ROLE

You will be the overall project manager at the Conscious Stories - also known as the Conscious Stories Mama.

What does this mean? That you’ll be grand central station for all of our projects. You’ll break down our goals into deliverables, hand them off to the right people, then make sure everything is on track and getting done on time. You’re the go-to person for questions, resources, or whatever our team needs to get the job done.

You are excellent at translating big ideas into projects, from figuring out the master plan to figuring out exactly which details need to be executed when.

Basically, you are the one who keeps our virtual office humming every day. You keep our team happy and our projects on time. We are mostly a virtual office — that means everyone (including you!) works from your own home office. This means you get all the best parts of interacting with a super fun team, with none of the commute and cubicles! Although your day to day will involve working closely with our small team, you need to be the kind of person that enjoys working from home and managing their own time.  That said, we recognise the importance of getting together, and homebase is Nashville TN.

Some of your big picture tasks will include:

  • translating big ideas into projects, deliverables, & timelines

  • working with CEO to determine top 3 monthly goals, then tracking progress/success on those goals

  • monitoring our task management system actively look for roadblocks and making sure everything is progressing

  • overseeing all of our website, social media and fulfillment center and working with our team to make sure they’re operational and up to date

  • facilitating weekly team meetings

 

Some Specific Tasks Include:

EVENT PLANNING

  • Identify and select trade shows and book them

  • Find speaking opportunities and book them (Schools, Unity, CSL, etc)

  • Find paid author reading opportunities in schools, and manage ongoing relationships

  • Build local events around key trade shows and existing travel events.

 

CEO SUPPORT

  • Facilitate CEO’s work process by listening, observing and asking questions that move projects forward efficiently

  • Daily workday check-ins with CEO to manage priorities, answer questions and handle issues

  • Manage CEO’s schedule

  • Ensure CEO writes

 

SPECIAL PROJECTS

  • Setup system to get customer book reviews

  • Implement or manage the implementation of simple online marketing funnels

 

RETAIL CUSTOMER SUPPORT

  • Provide lots of love to subscribers

  • Respond to customer contact emails

  • Customer relations replies about book orders, club offerings, etc.

  • Follow up with all lost shipping and report to customers

  • Keep the database up to date

  • Process miscellaneous payments from customers

  • Offer coupons to turn customer complaints around

  • Correct any shipping errors

  • Respond to social media comments to create conversation

  • Respond to FB Page messages and questions

  • Develop FAQ list with help from CEO

 

WHOLESALE CUSTOMER SUPPORT

  • Manage Wholesale distributors to ensure reporting of monthly inventory

  • Manage consignment stock reports and audit payments

  • Represent the brand in local retail sales discussions

  • Maintaining ongoing bookstore relationship

  • Create new accounts in quickbooks and issue invoices

  • Set up new accounts in Infusionsoft CRM and tag them as accounts

  • Support annual launch of new books


 

YOUR SKILL SET

  • A willingness and confidence to reach out and find new opportunities for speaking and school engagements for Andrew.

  • Able to learn new software fast and comfortable with online marketing world. Able to research new software systems, learn how to use them, and set them up for the company.

  • Experience with Google Drive, Dropbox, Facebook (pages for business) necessary.

  • Comfortable posting new blog articles, copy or photos to an ecommerce site (we use Cratejoy, which is much like any other.) Also comfortable editing product descriptions, pricing or photos.

  • Previous CRM and email marketing software experience essential. Familiarity with Infusionsoft preferred. Ability to load and send emails, manage tags and lists, add and remove subscribers etc.

  • Excellent English and grammar skills for interacting with customers by email and phone.

  • Able to adopt our company’s voice and speak as our Conscious Club Mama offering customer service via phone and email.

  • Must be able to self-generate tasks that move business and projects forward, especially when CEO is out of town.

  • Be amazing at checklists (we use Trello)

  • Ensure details don’t slip through the cracks or fall off of the schedule.


 

BONUS SKILL SET

  • Familiarity with Cratejoy, Trello, Buffer, and Adobe Creative Suite is helpful.

  • Background in publishing is a bonus.

  • Experience creating reports in Quickbooks

  • Any experience with booking speaker into conference or trade show is very helpful

  • Minor graphic editing is helpful.

 

 

NOTABLES

  • This is a contract position starting at 15 hours /week, growing to 20 hours/week

  • $18 - $22/hr based on experience.

  • You must provide your own laptop.

  • If you are working locally in Nashville and working in person, you provide your own transportation. If you are working remotely you provide your own internet connection and phone service.

  • Candidates in Nashville will  be strongly considered, though this will also work well as a virtual position.


 

VISION AND VALUES

The Conscious Bedtime Story Club helps parents create moments of deep connection with their children through a year-long curriculum of spiritual bedtime stories and easy mindfulness practices.

 

These deep moments of connection help kids and parents grow in confidence and esteem as the feel more safety, love and belonging. They are the pillars of healthy relating, and ultimately serve to  grow a stronger society.

 

We believe:

● The last 20 minutes of each day are precious.

● Connection is at the heart of everything.

● Life is a spiritual journey

● Children have wisdom from the day they are born.

 

Our culture is  centered around connection. We include ourselves deeply in our work.  Our work-life-health balance is important. We are role models to our customers and to the children, so integrity is essential. Everyone who works on the team loves the product, shares the vision and supports in the creation of world-class, pioneering, compassionate, spiritual, engaging product and services.

 

We strongly believe in meditation as a way to center and enable healthy relationship with work and the world. We are all about self-responsibility and strive for a zero-blame, zero-guilt working environment.

 

ABOUT THE BUSINESS

Conscious Stories LLC is a USA business, based in Nashville Tennessee. We are 3 years old, and currently have 12 titles in print, all written by Andrew Newman. In the USA these books are available one-at-a-time or on a 12-month subscription.  We partner with fulfillment centres and specialist distribution partners to provide books through bookstores, our website and online partners.

 

The team of 9 are spread throughout the world, with specialist areas of focus and responsibilities. The primary market is the USA and secondary South Africa, with long term expansion into UK and translation partnerships with foreign publishers.

 

ABOUT ANDREW

Andrew Newman has followed his deep longing for connection and his passion for spiritual development in a 12 year-long study of healing. He is a graduate of the Barbara Brennan School of Healing and a qualified Non-Dual Kabbalistic healer. Andrew has been actively involved in men’s work through the Mankind Project since 2006.

 

His portfolio of work alongside his therapy practice includes;  publishing over 2500 donated poems as the PoemCatcher, volunteer coordination for Habitat for Humanity in South Africa and directing Edinburgh’s Festival of Spirituality and Peace.

 

Andrew believes that the last 20 minutes of every day are precious.

His latest project, The Conscious Bedtime Story Club, is a culmination of all of these areas of experience, intended to bring parent and child into deeper connection and spiritual union with each other.

 

ABOUT THE BOOK COLLECTION

Conscious Bedtime Stories Collection is designed to help parents connect with their children in the last 20 minutes of the day. The stories each have a simple breathing meditation to start story-time, love-able heroic characters on great adventures and reflective activity pages to open conversations.  The books have a core lesson that is clearly named on the cover, so that parents can choose their favourite.

Marketing Project Manager for Super Awesome Online Agency & Training Company

Thrive Marketing®

In our opinion, there are two sides to being a stellar marketing project manager — managing projects and managing people.   We’re looking for someone who is absolutely INCREDIBLE at both!  

——-ABOUT YOU** ——-**

So let’s start by talking about you.

You are outrageously organized — color-coding, folders, and systems are the stuff of dreams. Taking an idea and turning it into a timeline of clear deliverables actually sounds like a fun way to spend a day to you!

You are incredibly skilled at both micro and macro thinking — making sure the big picture is always moving forward by way of all the tiny details that need to get done.  

You also love people — you’re a natural mentor and sounding board, and knowing that you helped someone else succeed gives you enormous satisfaction. You love coaching people to do their best, seeing people’s strengths and talents and drawing it out of them even more. You naturally pick up on subtle team dynamics and are able to proactively jump in to assuage a concern or just offer a few words of encouragement.

You are an incredible problem solver — you are strategic, clever, and quick on your feet. You’ll be the go-to person when we’re trying to figure out a sticky issue.  

You are extremely resourceful and great at playing detective — you can unravel any problem and figure out what’s really going on, what the missing pieces are, and go out and find them.  

You do NOT thrive on being micromanaged and love to be given the freedom to excel in your job. Being your own boss within an organization is a dream come true for you.  

You are open, direct, and straightforward. You believe that honesty, awareness, and ownership are the direct routes to problem solving. You’d rather not play the “blame game,” but instead just correct the issue and keep moving! You are a solution-based thinker who investigates why things went wrong with the goal of improving the process. You believe that a process problem lies at the root of every apparent people problem.  

It is pretty impossible to faze you and you’re able to take a hit and keep rolling — your goal is to get it done, even if the path that gets there isn’t quite the one that you anticipated!  

——-About This Role ——-

You will be the overall marketing project manager at Thrive Marketing®. What does this mean? That you’ll be grand central station for all of our projects. You’ll break down our goals into deliverables, hand them off to the right people, then make sure everything is on track and getting done on time. You’re the go-to person for questions, resources, or whatever our team needs to get the job done. You are excellent at translating big ideas into projects, from figuring out the master plan to figuring out exactly which details need to be executed when.

You’ll also be our “virtual office manager,” doing HR types of tasks like paying vendors, signing off on time sheets, and interfacing with our CEO to keep tabs on project budgets.

Basically, you are the one who keeps our virtual office humming every day. You keep our team happy and our projects on time.

We are a virtual office — that means everyone (including you!) works from your own home office. This means you get all the best parts of interacting with a super fun team, with none of the commute and cubicles! Although your day to day will involve working closely with our small team, you need to be the kind of person that enjoys working from home and managing their own time. Some of your tasks will include: 

  • translating big ideas into projects, deliverables, & timelines
  • working with everyone on our team to determine their top 3 monthly goals, then tracking progress/success on those goals
  • monitoring our task management system actively look for roadblocks and making sure everything is progressing
  • overseeing all of our sites and working with our team to make sure they’re up to date
  • overseeing course content creation — working with our team to break down the course, put together the materials, & make it live and functionalfor customers
  • facilitating weekly & daily team meetings

**This is a 40/hr week remote contract position. You’ll be working independently from your own home.  

——-About Our Company——-**
 

Founded in 2004, Thrive Marketing® is an award-winning, full-service digital marketing agency, specializing in marketing automation and building highly converting websites and sales funnels.  

Thrive Marketing’s mission is to make an epic difference in the world by enabling our clients to serve as many people as possible – by promoting their life-changing services and products to the masses. And we accomplish this with the help of our ‘Code to Thrive By’ — doing what we say we’ll do, working smarter not harder, keeping our culture drama-free, and being passionate about people and their dreams. Our clients are established, reputable businesses in the health, technology, professional and eCommerce verticals.  In other words, we serve the healthy, the geeky, the dynamic and the digitally-inclined people of the world!

You will be expected to develop, iterate, and execute on Fastly’s global strategy to deliver customer content efficiently and at low costs to Fastly. The team is also responsible for project management of our deployments, so the ability to get your hands dirty with some field work alongside your team is also possible. It is expected that you participate in industry forums such as NANOG, RIPE, APRICOT, LACNOG, GPF, EPF, and APF because you will own key strategic relationships with partner networks.

Our edge cloud is deployed over 43 global points of presence (POPs) on 6x continents, and we only expect the count of deployments to grow. The ability to use forecasts to create budgets is a required skill. Candidates should be extremely organized, detail oriented, and process driven individuals. Candidates must be able to work independently and cross functionally.

PRIOR EXPERIENCE

  • Prior leadership experience in engineering, data center management, interconnection, purchasing, or supply chain.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Must be a strong networker and communicator, both internally and externally. Network strategy requires as much human networking skill as it does technical chops.
  • Must be proficient in finance for managers including P&L and budgets.
  • Capable of designing metrics, iterating on measurement, and driving change.
  • Comfortable with Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, bonus for any of SQL, R, Python.

The business development manager is a consultative sales role at ConsenSys and will be working directly with the Enterprise team in a revenue-generating role, as well as representing broader ConsenSys products to prospective clients. This person will own all business development outcomes. We are looking for a variety of candidates and have needs for flavors of this role, some more partner-relationship centric and some more direct-client centric. Our business development managers lead technical and delivery teams through complex sales processes: requirements gathering, solution architecture, product and competitive positioning, partner enablement, proposal generation and drafting appropriately scoped statements of work. You could be onstage at a conference one day, working on a client proposal the next, and delivering partner training the following week, all while collaborating with our product teams on feature roadmaps, token launches or marketing roadshows.

A great candidate for this position will be confident when entering a board room setting and skilled at leading and supporting complex conversations with ease. This person will have a minimum of 3 - 5 years of experience working with with senior level business executives and technologists through enterprise software sales cycles, notably with experience in emerging technology ecosystems. This role does not come neatly packaged or defined. You should expect it to change during your time at ConsenSys, to evolve as our organization evolves. What does that mean for you? We think that means you will have an opportunity to create an exciting role with plenty of growth potential over time.

If you are ready to take the leap in joining a fast growing company in a business development capacity, we encourage you to apply today!

We are looking for a Digital Project Manager / Producer to join our team based in Cardiff. This is an exciting role in a fast-paced agency environment, where you'll be helping our team to stay on track, organised and delivering our projects on-time and within client's and management's expectations. As a small but fast-growing team, with an additional bank of freelancers, we're hiring for this role to help take us to the next stage of effective project management, communication and project delivery.

  • Have experience with project management or digital production.
  • Be enthusiastic about development, marketing and UX best practices.
  • Be analytical, handle multiple moving components with good attention to detail.

  • Comfortable with Apple Mac and easily adaptable to mastering softwares (project management specific).
  • Experience in dealing with teams of different sizes with creative and technical people (ability to keep on top as expand).
  • Knowledgeable on current web technologies and standards.
  • Comfortable at being challenged to learn new technologies
  • Strong attention to detail and dependability.

Benefits

We have a creative, flexible and growth-centred environment where you will be able to continuously develop. You’ll be working with Apple Computers and on project management and communication tools that we’ve not shied away from investing in. As an agency we provide a company pension, flexible hours, subsidised conference tickets & travel for WordCamps, annual team events and free beer Fridays!

items.title: Outbound Telesales Executive - Onify Ltd - Remote
items.content:
Outbound Telesales Executive
Onify Ltd -Remote
£18,000 - £25,000 a year - Full-time, Permanent

Fancy yourself as a telesales Rockstar? Do you want to be part of the core team in a new startup with huge ambitions? If you answered yes, read on. We have something very exciting to tell you about.

ONIFY is a fast growing startup built around loyalty, customer retention and rewards. Ever wondered why you keep all those loyalty cards? Now you don’t have to. ONIFY rewards your loyalty without you having to carry, collect and locate all those annoying paper cards. Now, you can keep them all on one simple-to-use app and access them at any time.

For businesses, this gives them a complete marketing and customer retention system, with no technology required in-store. No longer are these tools just available to the big players, we are putting them in that hands of everybody so businesses can focus on what they do best. We help them get their customers back through the door time and time again. We believe that we everyone should be rewarded for being loyal to local, independent businesses and ONIFY provides the tools to do just that.

We love our product, and businesses and customers love it as well. We now need to get it in the hand in as many businesses as possible and need somebody to contact potential customers and guide them through the FREE sign up process. This role will be a mix of cold calling, building and maintaining a sales pipeline.

Our team have built marketplaces from scratch before, and we are doing it again with ONIFY. In a brand new role for us, you will be working under the direction of the CEO (founder of fillmybelly.com and Ex Just Eat director), whilst gaining a valuable insight into what it takes to build a company from the ground up, as well as understanding how everything we do affects the growth of the company.

Key skills required:

  • Experience within a sales or telesales environment is a must
  • Self-motivation and ability to work remotely
  • Must be energetic and love what you do
  • A pleasant and confident telephone manner, able to speak to people at various levels of business
  • Able to demonstrate first-class, effective business to business communication
  • Able to handle rejection with the desire to hit targets
  • You will have good literacy and numeracy skills
  • Good IT skills and knowledge of CRM.
  • Monitor and update all sales related KPI’s

ONIFY are looking for an individual who is passionate about sales and can work hard and think positive in a fast-paced sales environment. A strategic thinker, with the ability to work effectively under pressure and be able to prioritise and meet sales targets and KPI's.

We are a remote business, which means all our employees currently work from a location that suits them. If you've never worked remotely before, don’t worry, you’ll soon grow to love it. We have daily video catch ups, weekly meetings and regular chat on our communication networks, so you won’t ever feel on your own for the day.

This position is full time, however, your hours can be flexible to fit around your personal circumstances and needs of the business. Access to a computer, fast internet and a quiet place to work from are essential. There will be a solid basic salary as well as tiered commision levels to really help incentivise your sales ability.

If this sounds perfect for you, please apply with a covering letter explaining why you would be perfect for the role along with your current CV. We will not be reviewing applications that don’t have a covering letter attached, so please include one if you are seriously interested in becoming part of our team.

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £18,000.00 to £25,000.00 /year

Required experience:

  • telesales: 1 year
